edu.stanford.math.plex4.homology.utility

Class HomologyUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.math.plex4.homology.utility.HomologyUtility

  • public class HomologyUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains static utility functions to aid the homology computations.
    Author:
    Andrew Tausz

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultBoundaryCoefficients

        public static int[] getDefaultBoundaryCoefficients(int length)
        This function returns the standard sequence of boundary coefficients used in simplicial homology, defined by c_i = (-1)^i. For small values of the desired length, it returns a precomputed array. This optimization is performed because this operation is done very often during homology and cohomology calculations. Also, almost all calls to this function will involve small values of the argument length, since most of the homological features of interest are in low dimensions. Nevertheless, this function will return the desired sequence even if the cache is not populated with the desired array.
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the array to get
        Returns:
        an array of with specified length containing the numbers (-1)^i

      • compareIntArrays

        public static int compareIntArrays(int[] array1,
                   int[] array2)
        This function performs a comparison of two arrays of ints. It returns a positive value if the first array is greater than the second, a negative value if the first array is less than the second, and zero if they are equal. The comparison is done as follows. First the lengths are compared. If they are unequal, then it returns the comparison of the lengths. If the array lengths are equal, it performs a dictionary comparison starting from the 0-th entry in the arrays.
        Parameters:
        array1 - the first array parameter
        array2 - the second array parameter
        Returns:
        1 if array1 > array2, 0 if array1 == array2, -1 if array1 < array2

      • removeIndex

        public static int[] removeIndex(int[] array,
                int index)
        This function returns a new array which contains the same entries as the supplied array except that the element at the specified index has been removed and the proceeding elements have been shifted down by one.
        Parameters:
        array -
        index -
        Returns:
        the array with the element at the specified index removed

      • appendToArray

        public static int[] appendToArray(int[] array,
                  int newValue)
        This function appends the argument newValue to the end of the supplied array. It does not modify the passed in array.
        Parameters:
        array - the array to append to
        newValue - the value to append
        Returns:
        the supplied array with newValue appended

      • lowerEntries

        public static int[] lowerEntries(int[] array,
                 int k)
        This function returns the first k entries of the supplied array.
        Parameters:
        array -
        k -
        Returns:
        the subarray array[0, ..., k]

      • upperEntries

        public static int[] upperEntries(int[] array,
                 int k)
        This function returns the last entries of the supplied array starting from the index k.
        Parameters:
        array -
        k -
        Returns:
        the subarray array[k, ..., array.length - 1]

      • computeIntersection

        public static gnu.trove.TIntHashSet computeIntersection(gnu.trove.TIntHashSet set1,
                                        gnu.trove.TIntHashSet set2)
        This function computes the intersection between two sets of integers.
        Parameters:
        set1 - the first set
        set2 - the second set
        Returns:
        a TIntSet containing elements common to both input sets
